menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration.

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.|4: BLE firmware update.|5: CAN Module firmware update.|9: CAN Module configuration update.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS|1: RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL|2: READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM|3: REBOOT. Reboot the terminal|4: RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings|5: PWROFF. Power off the device|6: CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID|7: CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ|8: VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER|9: BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT|A: IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ|C: GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM|D: AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|E: GSV/RSV/BSV/ASV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV/+RESP:GTRSV/+RESP:GTBSV/+RESP:GTASV|10: CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN|12: CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN|13: CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN|1C: ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI|22: CAN Module Operation. Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module|25: SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status|31: DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports|3A: RLY. Set the state of the WRL300|
menu3.Description: A HEX value which indicates the sub command of AT+GTRTO.

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 1 - RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 2 - READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM
menu3.Description: To get AT command configuration.
This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM|1: Add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM|

menu3.groupname: 4 - RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.
menu3.Description: To reset AT command configuration.

menu3.groupname: 6 - CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 7 - CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 8 - VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 9 - BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: A - IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: B - TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: C - GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: D - AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: E - GSV/RSV/BSV/ASV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV/+RESP:GTRSV/+RESP:GTBSV/+RESP:GTASV.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: It determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to and is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 10 - CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 12 - CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 13 - CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN. It works only when the <Accessory Type> of AT+GTBAS is 4 and the <Accessory Model> is 0. The <Mode> of AT+GTCAN also needs to be set to 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 1C, the basic information will be reported via the message +RESP:GTATI according to chosen <ATI Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 22 - CAN100 Operation. Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Read Car Model|1: Set Car Model|2: Start CAN Module Automatic Synchronization|
menu3.Description: If the sub command is 22, this parameter will work as follows.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: It determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to and is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 25 - SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status. It is used together with <SCS Action> below.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Read self-calibration status|1: Clear self-calibration status|
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 25, Read or Clear action is controlled by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 31 - DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.
3A - RLY. Set the state of the WRL300.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable relay of WRL300|1: Enable relay of WRL300|
menu3.Description: If the sub command is 3A, this parameter will work as follows.
It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS when the <Sub Command> is set to 3A.

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTP is used to obtain files from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File|
menu3.Description: The working mode of file transfer.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The type of communication protocol used to obtain data from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: It defines the type of file to download from the server.
It specifies the URL to download the configuration file.

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete File|1:Write File|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: It defines the type of file to download from the server.
The location where the current data is written to the file.
Total serial number of write file data.
Data written to file.
CRC verification data of <Data> is used to determine whether the data is correct.

menu2.name: LBC (SMS Location Request)
menu2.Description2: This command can only be sent via SMS. The device will send SMS report with Google maps hyperlink and the current location to corresponding phone number or report LBC to the backend server immediately.
